markdownRemark.html:
Think College has released three new publications. Their new Fast Fact, Peer Supports: Focusing on the Experiences of College Students with Intellectual Disability, summarizes findings from a qualitative study that interviewed college students with intellectual disability in an attempt to determine what is known about students in inclusive postsecondary education and their experiences with peer supports.

From the Field: Strategies on Career Development and Employment for Students with Intellectual Disability is a practical guide for college programs to support career development and employment opportunities for students.

Think College also released Insight Brief #45, Federal Financial Aid or Students with Intellectual Disabilities, which provides an overview of how students with intellectual disabilities can utilize federal financial aid to help pay for college.
